description: From Late Latin edibilis, from Latin edō (“eat”).

adjectives.description: edible (comparative more edible, superlative most edible)

entries.meaning: Capable of being eaten without harm; suitable for consumption; innocuous to humans.
Capable of being eaten without disgust.
examples: Although stale, the bread was edible.

entries.meaning: In which edible plants are grown for human consumption.
examples: Gardens do not contain flowers and ornamental plants, but edible plants. Although edible, these gardens are equally valued for their aesthetic qualities. It is women who collect from edible gardens,  […]

entries.meaning: (marijuana) a foodstuff, usually a baked good, infused with tetrahydrocannabinol from cannabutter etc.
